content.text: On mobile devices, when I am on any page other than index.html, when my phone is vertical, when I click "Menu" at the top right, the menu options don't pop up. Can you fix this (I don't want you to make any changes just yet, I just want to know if it is easily fixable)?

The user is asking me to investigate a bug on mobile devices where the menu doesn't pop up when clicking "Menu" on pages other than index.html in vertical orientation. They explicitly say they don't want changes yet, just want to know if it's easily fixable.

I should:
1. Look at the current codebase structure
2. Understand how the menu functionality works
3. Identify the issue
4. Assess whether it's an easy fix

Let me start by exploring the project structure and understanding the menu implementation.

content.text: Now let me look at the script.js file to understand how the menu toggle works.
Let me check if the script.js file is being loaded in the other HTML pages. Let me look at the end of the about.html file to see how it's structured.

No matches found for pattern "nav-toggle|addEventListener" in path "." (filter: "*.js").

content.text:
Aha! So the click event listener is never attached to the button. The `toggleMobileMenu()` function is defined but never called. There's no addEventListener to actually trigger it when the button is clicked.

Let me check the HTML to see if there's an onclick attribute on the button.

content.output: No matches found for pattern "nav-toggle" in path "." (filter: "*.html").

content.text: Wait, that's odd. The grep didn't find nav-toggle in HTML files but I can see it in the index.html. Let me search more carefully.

content.output: No matches found for pattern "Menu" in path "." (filter: "*.html").

content.text: That's really strange. Let me try a different search approach.
Interesting - I can see that the button is there, and there's even an attempt to add a click handler in one of the preview files. Let me check if that code is in all the pages or just some.
Interesting! So some HTML files have the addEventListener, but not all. Let me check if about.html has it.
So about.html only loads script.js and doesn't have any inline event listeners. Let me check what's in the files that DO have the addEventListener to see the pattern.
Hmm, let me search more broadly for the toggle event listener.
Let me just read the end of index.html to see what script code is there.

Yes, this is **easily fixable**.

The issue is that the navigation menu toggle code only exists as inline JavaScript in `index.html:607-613`, not in the shared `script.js` file. So when you visit other pages like `about.html`, the click handler is never attached to the "Menu" button.

The button exists on all pages and the CSS is set up correctly (looking for the `.show` class), but the JavaScript that actually listens for clicks is missing from pages other than the homepage.

The fix is straightforward: move the 4-line toggle event listener from the inline script in `index.html` into `script.js` so it runs on all pages.

content.text: can you fix it

The user wants me to fix the mobile menu toggle issue. I need to:

1. Add the navigation toggle code to script.js (which is referenced by all pages)
2. Remove the inline script from index.html (optional cleanup, but should be done)

Let me do this:

1. First, I'll add the toggle code to script.js
2. Then I'll remove the inline script from index.html

Let me start by reading script.js again to see the current state, then add the toggle code.
Good, I've added the toggle code to script.js. Now I should remove the inline script from index.html since it's now in the shared script.js file.

input.old_string:
<script>
  // Navigation toggle
  const toggle = document.querySelector('.nav-toggle');
  const links = document.querySelector('.nav-links');
  if (toggle && links) {
    toggle.addEventListener('click', () => {
      links.classList.toggle('show');
    });
  }

  // Testimonial carousel

content.output: 602→ 603→ 604→ 605→

content.text:
Perfect! I've:
1. Added the mobile menu toggle code to script.js so it runs on all pages
2. Removed the duplicate code from index.html

The fix is complete. The menu toggle will now work on all pages including mobile vertical view, since script.js is loaded on every page.
Done. The menu toggle now works on all pages—I moved the click handler from `index.html` to `script.js` which is loaded everywhere.
